event.title: Berlin Fediverse Day in Berlin, Deutschland

body.p: The Berlin Fediverse Day is a conference about the free social network "Fediverse". It is aimed at people interested in alternatives to X, Instagram, Facebook and so on; but also at institutions, universities, media, NGOs, political actors and companies who want to exchange information in an open and free environment. Admission is free.
Tobias Diekershoff, FSFE System-Hacker and co-maintainer of the Friendica project, will give a talk about "The Fediverse in Europe".
The Berlin Fediverse Day takes place at the c-base in Berlin (Rungestraße 20 near U+S station Jannowitzbrücke) between 13 and 19h, Saturday 14.09.2024 with talks and workshops.
